title: Ticket #6747: output and error files cannot be absolute paths on Windows
description:
The filename remapping code treats \ as an escape character in order to support = or ; in a filename. But this has the effect of removing all of the path separators \ from a windows file path unless they are doubled.

This is exacerbated by the fact that when you use an absolute path for output and error files, the filename remapping code is invoked automatically.

We should fix this by having the remapping code only strip \ when followed by = or ;.
remarks:
2018-Sep-26 13:49:05 by johnkn:
Comments in the code indicate that treating \ as an escape only when followed by = or ; is what the code intended to do all along.
